title: 115_hr2835
content: PERMANENT LOAN GUARANTEE FEE WAIVERS FOR VETERANS. Section 7(a) of the Small Business Act is amended to include a guarantee fee waiver for veterans or spouses of veterans. The Administrator may waive guarantee fees for loans up to $150,000 made to veterans or their spouses under Section 7(a) of the Small Business Act. The President's budget for the upcoming fiscal year may include a cost for the program established under this subsection. The President's budget for the upcoming fiscal year may include a cost for the program established under this subsection. In paragraph (16), a guarantee fee waiver for veterans is defined as per paragraph (31)(G)(iii). The Administrator cannot collect a guarantee fee for loans under $150,000 to veterans or their spouses after a certain date, unless specified in the President's budget for the next fiscal year. The budget for the upcoming fiscal year, as submitted to Congress, includes a cost for the program established under this subsection that is above zero. Loans made to veterans or their spouses under $150,000 may have a guarantee fee waiver, unless specified in the President's budget for the next fiscal year. In this subparagraph, the Administrator may not collect a guarantee fee for an express loan of up to $150,000 made to a veteran or spouse of a veteran after October 1 of the first fiscal year following a specified date. The Administrator may waive guarantee fees for express loans up to $150,000 for veterans or their spouses in the fiscal year following a specified date, unless the President's budget includes costs for the program.
